titleStmt.title: Nathaniel Gaither, Jr. to James W. Tate
CWG2557

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
OFFICE SECRETARY OF STATE,
Frankfort, Octo 2d, 1861.
To Jas W Tate Esq
Dear Sir:

I hereby with the consent of the Governor appoint you Assistant and Clerk to the Secretary of State of Kentucky and empower you as such to sign my name as such to all official papers, which it may become necessary for me to sign and this you will enter upon the Executive Journal and proceed to execute the duties of your office

Nat Gaither Jr
Secy of State
I approve & consent to the appointment of Jas W Tate as assistant & Clerk to the Secretary of State

I George W. Gwin a Justice of the peace for Said County do certify that James W Tate this day came personally before the me and took the oath prescribed in the first Section of the Eighth Article of the Constitution of Kentucky for the faithful discharge of the duties of Assisttant and Clerk to the Secretary of State of Kentucky under the within appointment --
Given under my hand this 3d. day of October 1861
